doc:
Fontaine La Rue https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fontaine_La_Rue 0 Matilda Fernández, stage name Fontaine La Rue (December 2, 1897 in Los Angeles – November 20, 1976) was a Mexican American silent film actress appearing in films from 1915 to 1929. Her career ended with the advent of talkies. Presumably her exotic sounding French name was used to get her classier roles in films. Notably she appeared in the now lost film, A Blind Bargain with Lon Chaney. Matilda_Fernández , stage_name_Fontaine_La_Rue ( December_2_,_1897 in Los_Angeles – November_20_,_1976 ) was a_Mexican_American_silent_film_actress appearing in films from 1915 to 1929 . Her_career ended with the_advent of talkies . Presumably her_exotic sounding French_name was_used to_get her_classier_roles in films . Notably she appeared in the_now_lost_film , A_Blind_Bargain with Lon_Chaney .
